intro: Clermontia oblongifolia f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved clermontia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. It is a perennial shrub that produces bright orange or red flowers, attracting pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
